root: ^At last, Mothman has shown himself. You note it is much later in the day than you would have expected for him.
^He seems extremely impatient, fidgeting with his shirtsleeves.
^“I am assuming the worst, since I didn’t receive any calls in my room.”
^Here’s your big moment, do you tell him the truth?
^Lie about the phone lines being broken.

lie: ^“Is there anything that works in this Moth forsaken Motel?”
^You smile sheepishly, hoping he doesn’t notice your anxiety. You always were a terrible liar.
^His gaze slips to the notes on your desk, then back up at you.
^“Hold on a minute, I see my name written down right there!”
^“Why lie to me?? Are you not a receptionist, is your job not to assist??!”
^“Sorry, I panicked, and by the time I answered the phone it was too late…”
^He grabs the notes from you and quickly reads them over, face souring.
^“This is not ideal, but I will have to make do.”
truth: ^You choose to admit you handled the call yourself, since you were so curious.
^“It is completely and utterly disgraceful to receive a private call intended for another person, especially when it concerns business.”
^He seems to pause for a moment, cooling off from momentary anger. You already knew what you did was wrong.
^“Still… I am somewhat grateful I didn’t have to deal with my publishers alone.”
^You notice he visibly relaxes at this realization, a smile creeping onto his face.
^“Your gesture is… strangely valiant. To come to the aid of someone in peril, even when faced with the unknown…”
^The blush vanishes as quickly as it appeared.
thesituation: ^“I suppose it's only fair to tell you how I got myself into this situation in the first place.”
^“Woe is me, the life of an Author can be full of trials and tribulations.”
^“One of which is the release of my latest novel… ‘Conquer the Conquered’... and whatever they decided to put as the sub-heading.”
^“I have been in the historical fiction niche for quite some time, and even I have to admit this was a low blow, even by my standards.”
^“I’ve released sequels, threequels, a pentalogy… but nothing comes close to this!”
^“I fear I have already hit my creative peak and it’s only downhill from here.”
^You choose to stay silent about the fact he’s no doubt profited enough from these books already to inevitably retire comfortably.
^Respecting the artist for their art becomes rather difficult when they are a lavishly dressed gentleman and you are a mundane Motel Receptionist.
^“Nevertheless, the publishers want what they want, and what they wanted was a ‘tasteful shift in time period to keep things new and fresh with the audience’.”
^“Why do you hate this book so much?”
^“Don’t get me started. I can recite the blurb to you, seeing as I was forced to memorise it.”
^“A tale of two opposing forces on the brink of destruction, set against the backdrop of the Roman Empire..."
^"A story filled with action packed violence, desperation and brutal drama. Who will be left conquered, and who will be the conqueror?”
^“Such boring drivel, I didn’t even get a say in what was written for that. I believe it was Aubrey, probably.”
^Well that certainly was a description for a book. What do you think? Did it inspire you with the passion of the Roman Empire?
^“I don’t know, I think I would buy it!”
romannah: ^You express your absolute and utter abhorrence for the phrases that just left his mouth.
^<i>That is not literature, you exclaim in feverish tones... that is tasteless rubbish!!
^“At last, an opinion of merit, spoken with such class!”
^He is beaming proudly, clearly feeling satisfied you agree with him so wholeheartedly.
^The book didn’t sound great, but you also don’t share his interest and knowledge in history.
^Truthfully, you just wanted to say something that would cheer him up.
romanyes: ^Obviously not the words he wanted to hear, but sometimes you have to strike a little bit of reality into the heart of someone absorbed so constantly by their ego.
^“Did my publishers pay you off already or something? Anyone with sense can tell how bad that was...”
proposition: ^“Regardless of your personal opinions, I prefer things with subtle emotion, tension, and true romance.”
^“I suppose it isn’t a secret anymore so I will tell you directly. I am currently working on something much more to my tastes.”
^His pride at this admission is evident. You are very intrigued about what sort of book this could be.
^“I’m sure you are dying to know… but I want to keep it secret for now. The public aren’t ready… but soon they may be.”
^A plan begins to formulate in your head- maybe you could encourage him to talk about his new release, proving to those nasty publishers that he still has tricks up his sleeve!
^“I’m happy to help with whatever you need.”
^Mothman seems taken aback at this declaration. Maybe this was too much fraternization for him to handle…
^“Is this in regards to my manuscript? I don’t think I’m quite ready yet.”
^“It will take some time to prepare to unleash this side of myself.”
^“Besides, I don’t quite know you. Notwithstanding the fact my personal matters have been exposed to you unwillingly these past few days.”
^He seems to stiffen up more as he speaks, fighting against some internal conflict.
^“Terribly sorry, but perhaps this discussion is best left for another time.”
^“I hope you have a pleasant afternoon.”
^You wonder what side of him he is so hesitant to ‘unleash’. No doubt something equally as dreary as his interest in history.
^Still, maybe there’s more to this than meets the eye?
^It’s best to forget about your foolish offer to help. He probably has it under control. Definitely.
